repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This specifically applies to for-loop iteration over strings etc. It avoids the need to store them away in generator closures and generally wasting runtime work for them.

Factors a dedicated `CArrayNode` out of the `ListNode` for the "list as C array" case, to avoid complicating `ListNode` for this. I kept `ListNode` as a base class mostly just in case we need some of its functionality later on, but I'm not aware of anything specific that is needed. It could probably just be a `SequenceNode`.

It'd be a somewhat large change for 3.2.x but maybe not too risky. Thus also the `ListNode` base class, to reduce the risk of unanticipated changes.

Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/7323

commit.message:
Prevent an invalid assignment from a C string array.
Previously, "cdef char[3] name = 'ABC'" tried to cast the C string constant to a C array type and tried to copy that into the stack array.
Add tests for string iteration in generator expressions.
Use a "static const" C array for constant array literals to avoid having them turn up in closure temps etc.
Prevent casting a literal const C array to non-const when memcpy()ing it.

Revert "Prevent casting a literal const C array to non-const when memcpy()ing it."

It was not strictly related to this PR.
This reverts commit dd7b8302b229f4a5b9cfc18f48d0f782400b7f20.
Add missing newline at end of test file.

title: Use `static const` C arrays for constant C array literals
